tool.name: SemanticValidator
tool.description: SemanticValidator for semantically validating certain XML files.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir mapping_file && ln -s '$mapping_file' 'mapping_file/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $mapping_file.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($mapping_file.ext)' && #if $cv: mkdir cv && mkdir ${' '.join(["'cv/%s'" % (i) for i, f in enumerate($cv) if f])} && ${' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'cv/%s/%s.%s' && " % (f, i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($cv) if f])} #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -mapping_file 'mapping_file/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $mapping_file.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($mapping_file.ext)' #if $cv: -cv ${' '.join(["'cv/%s/%s.%s'"%(i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($cv) if f])} #end if | tee '$stdout'
## Postprocessing #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.label: Mapping file which is used to semantically validate the given XML file against this mapping file (see 'share/OpenMS/MAPPING' for templates)
Controlled Vocabulary files containg the CV terms (if left empty, a set of default files are used)
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
SemanticValidator for semantically validating certain XML files.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/nightly/html/UTILS_SemanticValidator.html
